subproject.description:
The Global Fund to Fight HIV/AIDS, TB and Malaria (GFATM) approved the grant to Montenegro on HIV/AIDS in Round 5 in amount of 2,424,124 €. The total amount of approved funding for two years (Phase 1) was 1,329, 972 €. The starting date of the Grant was 1st August 2006. The Grant Agreement was signed on 28th May 2006.
The goal of the programme is to maintain low HIV prevalence in Montenegro. In concrete terms:
1. To prevent HIV transmission among most-at-risk populations 
2. To improve the quality of care and support to PLHIV 
3. To create a supportive environment for HIV prevention and care 
4. To strengthen the HIV surveillance system among most-at-risk populations 
5. To increase the capacity and coordination of a focused response to HIV among most-at-risk populations 
6. Target groups: Injecting Drug Users (IDUs), Sex Workers (SWs), Men who have sex with Men (MSM), Merchant Marines, Prisoners, poor RAE youth, young people and PLHIV.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Support to Montenegrin HIV/AID
